intro: Codonopsis macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered Chinese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowering period occurs in summer, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens. The plant is also valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
